intro: Alvaradoa haitiensis, commonly known as Haitian alvaradoa, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Haiti. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
